bullets.text: Taiwan commits $250B to U.S. semiconductor manufacturing, deepening supply-chain decoupling from China and tying Taiwan security more closely to U.S. industrial policy.
TSMC posts another record quarter; profit up 35% on AI chip demand, reinforcing AI-led capex cycle and tight leading-edge capacity competition.
U.S. imposes 25% tariff on Nvidia H200 chips headed to China, escalating AI compute export controls and raising costs for China-facing cloud and model training.
NATO nations deploy to Greenland after tense U.S. talks, signaling heightened Arctic militarization and alliance friction over territory, basing, and shipping routes.
Iran’s prolonged internet shutdown boosts reliance on Starlink and offline-mesh tools, complicating state censorship and adding geopolitical risk around satellite connectivity.
Oil drops over 4% as traders price reduced near-term Iran strike risk; underscores how Middle East escalation expectations quickly reprice energy risk premia.
Fed’s Goolsbee warns inflation could return if central-bank independence erodes, highlighting governance risk as a macro driver of inflation expectations and term premia.
Fannie/Freddie IPO plan remains uncertain as housing affordability priorities clash with privatization aims, affecting mortgage spreads and long-run U.S. housing finance structure.
Morgan Stanley beats earnings expectations on wealth management strength, reinforcing fee-based business resilience even as investment banking remains cyclical.
Goldman explores prediction markets as retail participation surges; potential new trading/market-making revenue but with elevated regulatory, integrity, and reputational risk.
Amazon says its $475M Saks stake is now worthless after bankruptcy, spotlighting rising distress risk in luxury retail and strategic partnership fragility.
Wikimedia partners with major AI firms for access/licensing, accelerating paid data pipelines for model training and shifting economics of open knowledge and content provenance.
Large observational study suggests statins may extend lifespan for most people with type 2 diabetes, strengthening the case for broader lipid management in this population.
Scientists question safety of some BPA-free packaging alternatives, implying potential regulatory shifts and reformulation costs across food, beverage, and consumer packaging supply chains.
Alaska Arctic enters a new, extreme wildfire era, raising long-term climate-risk costs for infrastructure, insurance, and energy systems across northern latitudes.
